result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Alfred Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment, when agent deems it appropriate, commensurate with his treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to associate with known drug users, dealers or be where illegal drugs are used or sold.  

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person,  with any of the following individuals:  Nellie Blackdeer, Jesse Honaker, Amber Cornejo, Edward Nicholas, Kristy Honaker, Joshua Wright, Mary Fisher or Harley Est.  If agent deems it appropriate at a later date, may allow contact as to Harley Est only.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Amended 5/2/16:  Court grants jail credit of 82 days.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Rivard.  Parties have the revocation summary.  Defense has corrections as to credit.  In 15CF25, 136 days credit on amended JOC.  In 15CF144,  82 days credit on amended JOC. In 15CF211 case 82 days credit on amended JOC.  State recommended:  15CF25- 30 days jail.  Time served.  15CF144- 18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision.  3 years total.  Credit for  361 days.  15CF211 - 9 months jail.  All concurrent.  Time served.  Defense recommended:  15CF25.  Time served.  15CF144- 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision.  15CF211.  Time served.


15CF144- 18 months initial confinement,  18 months extended supervision.  Total: 3 years.   Credit for 361 days.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to random drug/alc. testing.  No contact with known illegal drug users or dealers.  Seek and maintain employment.  CC.  Follow all recommendations of his agent.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.  

Court ordered:  15CF25- 30 days jail.  Credit for 361 days.     15CF211- 9 months jail.  Credit for 361 days.

Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Stichert.  15CF25.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2.  Poss drug para.  DRI Count 1.;  15CF144 defendant plead no contest to count 2.  Poss meth.  DRI Count 1; 15CF211 defendant plead no contest to amended count 1, misd BJ.  Amendment granted.  DRI Count 2 ;  16CF24. DRI all counts.  Joint recommendation. for 3 years probation.  CC.  15FO585 and 15FO628 dismissed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Felony warnings given.    Defendant understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation:  Probation 3 years.  AODA, and recommended treatment, including inpatient treatment if deemed appropriate by his agent.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not associate with known drug users, dealers or be where illegal drugs are used or sold.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment when agent deems it appropriate.  Defense made a statement.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation on felony charge.  2 years on misd charges, concurrent.   AODA, and recommended treatment, including inpatient treatment if deemed appropriate by his agent. Must successfully complete inpatient treatment if utilized.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not associate with known drug users, dealers or be where illegal drugs are used or sold. Subject to random testing by his agent.  No contact with Nellie Blackdeer, Harley Est (if agent deems it apprpriate at a later date, may allow as to Harley Est only), Jesse Honaker, Amber Cornejo,  Edward Nicholas, Kristy Honaker, Joshua Wright, or Mary Fisher.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment when agent deems it appropriate, commensurate with his treatment needs.  CC, DNA surcharge and sample.  Attorney Stichert may withdraw as counsel after jail credit is determined.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Stichert.  May have an agreement.  Keep motion hearing on for 4/21 at 9:00 am.  .  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  Plead to 2 misdemeanors.  Let the court know by tomorrow morning.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  According to DA Fox, new charges will be filed.  Defendant missed court because he got up late and then was late for bond hearings also.   Did not know about the preliminary hearing date.  Defendant has not contacted his attorney, said he doesn't know his attorney's number.  Address confirmed by court.  STC set for 2/8/16 at 3 pm.  Attorney may appear by telephone.  Cash bond set.  Defendant told to contact his attorney.
